posts.post_content: At first glance, the card is terrible. But you have to make your deck around it. I envision it in a Grixis deck that has cards like: [Spiteful Visions](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Spiteful Visions), [Forced Fruition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Forced Fruition), [Kederekt Parasite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kederekt Parasite), and [Phyrexian Tyranny](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Tyranny).
posts.html:
At first glance, the card is terrible. But you have to make your deck around it. I envision it in a Grixis deck that has cards like: Spiteful Visions, Forced Fruition, Kederekt Parasite, and Phyrexian Tyranny.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: Arachibutyrophobia (8/15/2009 10:28:47 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This is an odd one. Not the greatest, but there's potential for this card. It's like arachibutyrophobia said, your deck must be designed for this card to fit in, but if it is, it will work very well.  
  
Some cards I think would make the deck work are:  
  
[Spiteful visions](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spiteful visions)  
[underworld dreams](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=underworld dreams)  
[sign in blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sign in blood)  
  
[forced fruition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=forced fruition)  
[kederekt parasite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=kederekt parasite)  
[reckless scholar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=reckless scholar)  
  
and of course, [twincast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=twincast) would help this out quite a bit.  
Imagine casting this one time after a forced fruition caused your opponent to draw seven cards, then casting it again with a twincast.  
  
Please draw 9 cards, then take 9 damage, then draw 2 more cards, then take 11 more damage.
posts.html:

Some cards I think would make the deck work are:

and of course, twincast would help this out quite a bit.

posts.post_content: I agree, at first glance this card is horrible. "Drawing two cards, and have them take two damage (three tops)? That sucks!" But as the combos stated above, it IS quite lethal. The most they would take is like 10 (because of [Forced Fruition](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Forced Fruition) ad the their draw step. And I agree, put this combo on a Grixis deck and have fun!

posts.post_content: This card works very well for me. I play it in two separate U/R decks, and both make excellent use of it. Either use it at the end of your opponents turn for 2 cards two damage, or twincast it on your opponent for an 8 damage finisher for 5 mana, [pyromancer ascension](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=pyromancer ascension) a lot of great ways to use this card. Any U/R deck that I play would almost definitely have this card, especially since I almost always bring [twinscast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=twinscast)

posts.post_content:
Even without support, it's instant speed draw 2 for yourself and 1 damage to your opponent, or more if they drew additional cards on their turn, for only 3 mana.  
  
Nowadays, we get [Divination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Divination), sorcery speed and without the addition of dealing 1 or more damage to your opponent.  
  
Competitively costed instant draw is never bad.
